title: Got an Email about a banned account. I logged into mine at its fine. Scam?!?
body:
The email i got was from Leagueoflegends@email.riotgames.com Would this be the email i would get one from or is this just someone fishing. If not I have a big issue. And if it is then i am sure i am not the only one who got this. 

This is what it read. And know that i have never cheated or begin to known how to.




Hello Summoner, 

Your account was banned due to the use of malicious 3rd party programs or modifications to your League of Legends client. We believe that all players should play on equal footing in an effort to promote competitive sportsmanship. You should be aware that modifying your League of Legends client is against the Terms of Use: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse. We hope you can see that it is unsatisfying to play against other players who are using a tool to gain an advantage over others. 

If you wish to dispute the actions taken against your account, you may contact us via this link: http://support.riotgames.com

replies.body:
The address associated with the email you received is not a scam and is from Riot Games. Check [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751784-Emails-from-Riot-Games ) for more information on identifying emails from Riot. 

Please keep in mind that you may have more than one account associated with this email address.  Either of these accounts could have disciplinary actions taken on it within the next few hours.

----------------------------------------------

**Edit for clarification purposes: This ban wave was specifically for botting, which is accomplished using 3rd party programs. **

I think you might want to consider sending a message to whoever may be in charge of these things. Almost everyone has said they know they haven't used any third party programs, myself included, and that they've received the email. I've got real life friends who have received the emails as well, and they say the same thing. I think there has been some sort of MAJOR failure in your system somewhere.

Yeah I am genuinely confused about this. I literally have gone through a long process of playing games up to level 30, and placed myself in silver. Climbed to plat, and am now close to diamond, and now i'm supposedly going to be banned for Mods? I don't even know of any mods that exist in this game. I do have a Blakinola announcer pack installed but, is that illegal?
If you're certain about that first bit, I wouldn't mind providing some of your account's leveling statistics here for clarification.  Just let me know if that's something you'd be alright with.
I know i have more than a few accounts tied to this email. Anyway to know what account/accounts this is directed at?

Wouldn't want to share that publicly, but it's not the account you're currently posting on.

You can submit a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) for more information.
could you also tell me if the account I am posting on right now is the one being banned?

Neither of these are the ones identified as bots, though the emails associated are identical. 

It's important to note that if you've purchased accounts in the past, they were likely leveled using a botting service (and would be similarly caught under these suspensions).

> [{quoted}](name=Riot of Penguins,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=4o1fhAsN,comment-id=000d00000000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-13T01:08:23.816+0000)

> It's important to note that if you've purchased accounts in the past, they were likely leveled using a botting service (and would be similarly caught under these suspensions).

Can I ask, if someone has two accounts, and one has issues with botting, but the other account is completely fine, will both be banned?

I have two accounts, one I leveled 1-30, over the course of months, the other account I was given by a friend to practice my adc mechanics, I barely play it. They're both in silver. I assume that one was botted, as I don't really know anything about the account or how it got from 1 to 30. There were lots of weird dominion games in its match history.

In the end, I really don't care what happens to the account I was given, I didn't really play on it, but my other account has hundreds of dollars worth of skins, memories, friends, etc.

I love the game, never was it my intent to bend the rules or make the game less fun for anyone.

tl;dr 

What is the severity of these punishments? Nobody seems to have actually been banned yet, but how many accounts will be affected? Will there be a chance for appeal / discussion?

Thanks
No, only the account that was botted up would be banned.

I got a similar email related to my account and since the 2 years I've been playing, I haven't used a single 3rd party program for anything, I know riot support is under a lot of traffic because of this so I would love if you could see the history on this account to confirm that it wasn't botted.
I can't comment/confirm anything on an individualized account level. You'd have to write into support for that.

Likewise, there's nothing prohibiting someone from creating a second account, and playing on it. There's no clear warnings, at least. I assumed that with most professional players having multiple accounts, Turtle and Pobelter to name a few, that there wasn't an issue with it. If I was wrong in that assumption, my apologies to Riot. I hope that mistake isn't something that I'm going to be banned over.  I haven't ever participated in botting, I have no knowledge of it, nor is it something I'm interested in. 

Would love to know more about what's going on, if possible, Riot of Penguins.

it's not having multiple account the problem here, the problem is the way those account were level up.

You can't just take something that look suspicious and say after, well it's not me I just buy it/receive it.

For safety, when it goes to side account, it's better (even if it take time) to grind it yourself (at least that way you know the past of it)
ah ok, thanks for checking.

I can assure you that there has not been any issues with this detection. We never want to punish anyone unfairly and we use extreme caution to ensure that only those who are using 3rd party mods have been actioned.

Rioters, keep downvoting your customers true statements and upvoting your false statements. Many of them are even courteous and professional in telling you how fucking incompetent you are. I on the other hand have no further patience for you and am seriously considering moving the $1000+/year revenue I give you to another company.

Riot has done some pretty bad things, but this isn't one of them. Just let him be mad he got banned for throwing money to buying an account and move on. On one of the forums I frequent people are complaining about being banned on an account they didn't buy, but have bought - so they did something right with the detections. Sure, he may not have bought his main, but I've yet to see someone being banned that hasn't bought an account at all, these detections are perfectly legitimate and I thank riot for finally putting their foot up the cheaters asses.

 EDIT: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/4o1fhAsN-got-an-email-about-a-banned-account-i-logged-into-mine-at-its-fine-scam?comment=000d00000000000100000000000100000000 he even admitted to buying accounts, I don't understand how some people remember to breathe.

What a lie, my friend got permabanned for botting and after he contacted support, they admitted it was a mistake and unbanned him.
Also your chat restrict system is a complete joke, i've seen people having like 5000 games lol.

Seems to be the general consensus on the subreddit where plenty of topics about this have popped up.  It's understandable to find a few people in denial over it, but this many seems to be a bit of a stretch. Maybe instead of assuring us you might consider taking the time to actually do a double-check.
I can assure you that you've made many errors with your detection, please use further care with your detection systems and speak to us with a bit more respect next time, cheers.
Just because you got caught and are mad doesn't mean you should be so rude to someone who's just doing their job. People like you are the reason Rioters don't interact with us as often.

indeed, if someone really made the process 'identify accounts to ban -> email accounts -> ban accounts' rather than 'email each account as it is banned' then tbh someone needs to be banned FROM THEIR JOB.

Indeed, This is probably the most piss poor job while banning accounts. You can't send an email to everyone saying HEY GUYS YOUR ACCOUNT IS BANNED yet...their account are still available giving access to purchases, gameplay etc. 
Whoever does this, needs to be properly trained in how the banning process works and what steps to take in order for the users to be at least aware of what happened and not wondering...Will I get banned? 

I love League of Legends. And Riot employees are mostly fun to talk to and even support people are enjoyable...of course not when the hodored outsourcing guys just send constant automated messages. Automated messages are what make people furious...just contact billing when that happens. Almost all issues get resolved right away by the billing department.

Riot Message on the Email: You're using a 3rd party software you're getting banned. "Which is not accurate of course, because people complaining here probably never used a 3rd party software they just purchased or obtained the account"

What really is happening here: You purchased an account and now you're getting sanctioned for it but we'll tell you it's a 3rd party software as an automated message because we better do shit fast and ban everyone at the same time instead of going on a case by case basis even if your account is profitable for us and you spent thousands of dollars already on your smurf because of course money is not a factor for us, which is good I guess, everyone needs to be treated equally in a free to play game.

If me or anyone purchased an account and this is the way they're "fighting 3rd party account purchases" then if they feel a ban needs to be done so be it but do it right. And of course chargebacks will come their way from several users, due to spending money on an account and having it taken away, Paypal is a terror for companies sometimes. 

What should really mitigate 3rd party website account purchases: Riot provides the ability to buy level 30 accounts to users with an already level 30 account that have been in the game for a while. But of course that will never happen because of all the EXP boosts and that is how those remain relevant.  

The reason I pretty much stopped playing and even spending truckloads amounts of money is pretty simple, their current Scrum master, team lead or Lead GM is trying to get shit done faster even if it includes accidentally banning several legit users as a counter effect. 

Shiz gets done, but just I feel it's not getting done the right way. Everyone was better in Season 2...the feels... 

That email they sent should have said: Stop purchasing crap for our game outside our store!

Witch Hunt Log:
Skins Removed People can't purchase limited skins anymore - Witch Hunt Crusade Complete, no one purchasing skins outside our Skin Mall anymore.
Refer a System Witch Hunt Crusade - Complete, everyone got their stuff removed, and given also an automated message similar like this.
3rd Party Purchases Witch Hunt Crusade - Complete, everyone got their accounts banned "or well not yet I guess"

The real source of the issue is not yet mitigated, however people affected will now possibly never buy shit from outside their game ever again. Unless of course, you're retarded and you think they won't do this type of things again.

Well said.  I bought $100 of RP just a few hours before getting the "You're banned!" email (it still hasn't been banned, btw).  And I have *no clue* if I even will be getting banned.

The communication from Riot so far has been pretty unsatisfactory - they're avoiding the key issues you pointed out.  There's also quite a few people claiming they are the original account owner, *and* they have never cheated, botted, etc.

To be honest, the ONLY thing this means for me is that I will be much more wary of purchasing RP, on both my smurfs and main.
